messages.message:
@pauline.comising / @Serena, I've been noodling on the concept of AI runtime behavior a bit more... feels like there are two potential ways we could manage this "major" version update from Legacy (1.x) --> Advanced (2.x).

1. Keep current behavior but extend update timeframe for "major" updates --> e.g. commercial apps could be forced to update in 3 mos, Enterprise in 12 mos.
2. Make major updates manual only --> this would be a behavior change for AI Runtimes. Apps configured to update automatically would only update automatically in case of minor version upgrades to 1.x stack.
We discussed #2 in PRD review but I'm feeling like #1 might actually be cleaner to explain and also means we don't break existing behavior for current apps configured to auto-update. We could always extend the timeline for major upgrades if we get pushback. Thoughts? cc: @Anil / @Abhishek Adupa
From an engineering perspective, 1 is a lot easier to implement! I also agree 1 is easier to explain, and we can always extend to X more months if necessary

Btw we’re not adding the 2.x AI runtime rn right? In the current AI runtime system, we don’t have a way to hide a version as internal preview only

So I’d recommend creating the 2.x AI runtime only when AI Hub Advanced is GA
